intro: Willoughbya firmula, commonly known as the ghost gum, is a flowering plant native to northern Australia. It is a small, evergreen tree or shrub that typically grows up to 5 meters in height. The plant features smooth, pale grey bark that peels in thin layers, giving it its common name. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and evergreen, with a silvery-white underside. Willoughbya firmula produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting nectar-feeding birds and insects.
